item.title: Camille add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Write it. Shoot it. Publish it. Crochet it, sauté it, whatever. MAKE." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Camille add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Camille add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Camille add a quote by Jennifer Weiner
item.description: "I think every person who is single should have a dog. I think the government should step in and intervene: If you're not married or coupled up, whether you've been dumped or divorced or widowed or whatever, they should require you to proceed immediately to the pound nearest you and select an animal companion." -- Jennifer Weiner

item.title: Camille add a quote by Mark Rothko
item.description: "I'm not an abstractionist. I'm not interested in the relationship of color or form or anything else. I'm interested only in expressing basic human emotions: tragedy, ecstasy, doom, and so on." -- Mark Rothko

item.title: Camille add a quote by Jeffrey Brown
item.description:
"-Here's a pretty shell for you.
-Oh, thank you my baby.
-Look, here's another one!
-Thank you.
-Look at this pretty one!
-Thank you.
-Here's a REALLY pretty one.
-Um, thank you.
" -- Jeffrey Brown

item.title: Camille add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Camille add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Camille add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "What I need is the dandelion in the spring. The bright yellow that means rebirth instead of destruction. The promise that life can go on, no matter how bad our losses. That it can be good again." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Camille add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Fire is catching! And if we burn, you burn with us!" -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Camille add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through." -- Ira Glass

item.title: Camille add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Camille add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Camille add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by Paula Fox
item.description: "A good novel begins with a small question and ends with a bigger one." -- Paula Fox

item.title: Camille add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Go then, there are other worlds than these." -- Stephen King

item.title: Camille add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Camille add a quote by Thomas Babington Macaulay
item.description: "What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!" -- Thomas Babington Macaulay

item.title: Camille add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Camille add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Camille add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I'd like to add some beauty to life," said Anne dreamily. "I don't exactly want to make people KNOW more... though I know that IS the noblest ambition... but I'd love to make them have a pleasanter time because of me... to have some little joy or happy thought that would never have existed if I hadn't been born." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Camille add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Camille add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Camille add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Summer afternoon—summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language." -- Henry James

item.title: Camille add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one <I>good</i> friend, you're more than lucky." -- S.E. Hinton
